awd_titl_txt: Research Experiences for Undergraduates in the Scientific   Applications of Neutrons
awd_abstract_narration: The scientific staff of the University of Missouri Research                     Reactor (MURR) are conducting an NSF REU Program utilizing the                  University's 10 megawatt research reactor.  Scientists trained in               physics, chemistry, and biochemistry supervise students working                 on projects in such fields as neutron optics, neutron                           diffraction, inelastic neutron scattering, analysis of stress in                materials, macro-molecular structure, radiation defects, nuclear                archaeology, geology, analytic epidemiology, nutrition and                      radiopharmaceutical chemistry.  The central focus is to utilize                 neutrons to interrogate or alter specimens.  The project areas                  mentioned are studied by a variety of nuclear techniques                        including: neutron interferometry, single crystal and powder                    neutron diffraction, triple-axis  neutron spectrometry, small                   angle neutron scattering, deep level transient spectroscopy,                    conventional and prompt neutron activation analysis,                            radionuclidic assay and radioisotope production.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
